strings.Value: "Citizens of Pitax! Irovetti is dead — the tyrant is no more. If you think this is a time for riots, you are mistaken. Surrender the troublemaker to the guards and leave peacefully, or I will have to disperse you by force!"
"Alondi, you dirtbag! You stand there pretending to be a hero — why don't you tell everyone why you were thrown out of the academy?"
"What's going on?"
[Watch silently]
[Attack] "Pigs! I'll burn you!"
"What are you doing? Shame on you! Look at yourselves — you're like animals! This is how you act after I freed you from that tyrant?"
"Let's go, Linzi. Let them do what they want. It's their city."
"Burn it all! The tyrant's dead, to the Hells with his legacy!"

{n}A crowd of citizens, armed with whatever they could find — bludgeons, daggers, torches — murmurs indignantly. They're listening to{/n} {d|Alondi}Alondi{/d}{n}. A man in expensive clothes lies at his feet, writhing in a puddle of blood as he presses his hand over a wound. You gather from the screaming crowd that this must be Nunzio Arpaia, Irovetti's master of ceremonies.{/n}

"Citizens of {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}! For too long have we tolerated a tyrant as he trampled our city into the mud! Well, no longer must we fear telling the truth. You've all read the {d|Linzi Book Gloss}book{/d} by Eobald the Insightful — the only art taught at the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy of Grand Arts{/g} was that of licking Irovetti's boots! We students were trained not as bards, but as jesters, like this man here!" {n}Alondi kicks Nunzio in the ribs, but he seems to have stopped moving entirely.{/n} "Enough of this mockery! Our art is finally free! We'll build our own academy — once we've burned this old travesty to the ground!"
"Wait, what are you doing?! We... we didn't write the book for THIS! Alondi, have you no shame? Do I have to remind you why you were-"

{n}Alondi interrupts Linzi, raising elated screams from the crowd.{/n} "Look, it's Linzi! The hero who revealed the truth to all of {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}! Hurrah! Hurrah! Glory to the heroes of the resistance! Down with Irovetti! Burn the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}!"
"Look! It's our new {mf|king|queen}! The one who liberated us from Irovetti's oppression! Glory to {mf|His|Her} Highness! Down with the tyrant! Hurrah!"

"Look at them! They killed Nunzio — a funny old man who'd never hurt a fly in his life. And now they want to burn down the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}! And it's... it's all because of our book..."
{n}Alondi pales, then flees. After some confused clatter, the crowd also wanders off.{/n}
{n}Alondi goes pale and tries to escape, but he's swiftly captured and handed over to the guards. The remaining crowd quickly scatters.{/n}
{n}The crowd's enthusiasm dies out. After a bit of confused clattering, the rioters clear out.{/n}
{n}Linzi stares at the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}, then nods and turns away.{/n}

{n}Linzi looks at you, surprised. Then she looks at the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy{/g}, and a scowl crosses her face.{/n} "Yes! Burn it! To the {g|Abyss}Abyss{/g} with the academy! To the Abyss with it all!"

{n}The crowd roars, a mix of rallying cries, curses toward Irovetti, and praise for you. Stones, then torches begin flying toward the {g|Academy of Grand Arts}Academy's{/g} windows, and smoke begins to billow over the building.{/n}
"That guy's slimier than a slug! Doesn't matter how many chances you give the likes of him — if they were shit, they'll stay shit. Hey, little one, can I kick him? Or you want to do it?"
"Sarenrae teaches that there are some people for whom sparing would be a waste of mercy. Much can be forgiven to a repentant sinner, but what can you do for one who does not want to reform?"
